fields.name: location_information_header
fields.content: 1. Your property

fields.name: location_why
fields.content:
Reporting your property location will help Whitman County better allocate Voluntary Stewardship Program resources.

Your address will never be shared with anyone.

Use one of the methods below to set your location:

fields.name: geolocation
fields.placeholder: _(Are you on your property now? Click here to locate yourself automatically.)

fields.name: drag_map_info
fields.content: Drag and zoom the map manually.

fields.name: wetlands_header
fields.content: 2. Wetland areas

fields.name: wetlands_information
fields.content:
Description

Wetland areas are inundated or saturated by surface water or groundwater.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_wetlands
fields.prompt: _(Is your property on any wetland areas?)

fields.name: frequently_flooded_header
fields.content: 3. Frequently flooded areas

fields.name: frequently_flooded_information
fields.content:
Description

Frequently flooded areas are subject to a 1% or greater chance of flooding every year.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_frequently_flooded
fields.prompt: _(Is your property on any frequently flooded areas?)

fields.name: geologic_hazard_header
fields.content: 4. Geologic hazard areas

fields.name: geologic_hazard_information
fields.content:
Description

Geologic hazard areas are susceptible to erosion, sliding, earthquakes, and other geological events.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_geologic_hazard
fields.prompt: _(Is your property on any geologic hazard areas?)

fields.name: critical_aquifer_header
fields.content: 5. Critical aquifer recharge areas

fields.name: critical_aquifer_information
fields.content:
Description

Critical aquifer recharge areas have a critical effect on aquifers used for potable water.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_critical_aquifer
fields.prompt: _(Is your property on any critical aquifer recharge areas?)

fields.name: wildlife_conservation_header
fields.content: 6. Fish & wildlife conservation areas

fields.name: wildlife_conservation_information
fields.content:
Description

Fish & wildlife conservation areas are managed to maintain populations of fish and wildlife.

Appearance on map

fields.name: private-property_on_wildlife_conservation
fields.prompt: _(Is your property on any fish & wildlife conservation areas?)

fields.name: stewardship_practices_header
fields.content: 7. Your stewardship practices

fields.name: stewardship_practices_information
fields.content:
Your actions count! Please fill out the form below to officially report stewardship practices on your property.

If you are unsure about the meaning of a stewardship practice, click the symbol for more information.

fields.name: tillage_management_header
fields.content: A. Residue and Tillage Management

fields.name: no_till
fields.prompt: _(I converted from a conventional tilled system to a no till/direct seed system)
fields.label: _(No till/direct seed)

fields.name: no_till_quantity
fields.prompt: _(On how many acres of land do you use a no till/direct seed system?)

fields.name: no_till_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you convert to a no till/direct seed system?)

fields.name: reduced_till
fields.prompt: _(I use reduced tillage, mulch tillage, or conservation tillage methods)
fields.label: _(Reduced/mulch/conservation till)

body: Mulch tillage systems use a single pass hoe drill or low disturbance two-pass system.
Conservation tillage systems use no inversion tillage equipment.

fields.name: reduced_till_quantity
fields.prompt: _(On how many acres do you use reduced/mulch/conservation tillage methods?)

fields.name: reduced_till_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last use reduced/mulch/conservation tillage methods?)

fields.name: cover_crop
fields.prompt: _(I plant cover crops)
fields.label: _(Cover crops)

body: Cover crops are planted immediately after harvest, and usually consist of a small grain or legume mix.

fields.name: cover_crop_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many acres of cover crop do you plant?)

fields.name: cover_crop_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last plant cover crops?)

fields.name: conservation_cover
fields.prompt: _(I have conservation cover on my property)
fields.label: _(Conservation cover)

body: Conservation cover consists of the establishment of permanent vegetative cover using native species.

fields.name: conservation_cover_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many acres of conservation cover do you have on your property?)

fields.name: conservation_cover_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last plant conservation cover?)

fields.name: filter_strips
fields.prompt: _(I have filter strips on my property)
fields.label: _(Filter strips)

body: Filter strips are areas of native herbaceous vegetation that remove contaminants from overland flow.

fields.name: filter_strips_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many acres of filter strips are on your property?)

fields.name: filter_strips_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last plant filter strips?)

fields.name: tillage_management_other
fields.prompt: _(I perform other residue & tillage management actions)
fields.label: _(Other tillage management practices)

fields.name: tillage_management_other_action
fields.prompt: _(Please describe your actions below)

fields.name: nutrient_management
fields.content: B. Nutrient Management

fields.name: integrated_nutrient_management
fields.prompt: _(I use integrated nutrient management practices)
fields.label: _(Integrated nutrient management)

body: Integrated nutrient management consists of basic nutrient management on land for proper rate, source, method of placement and timing of application.

fields.name: integrated_nutrient_management_quantity
fields.prompt: _(On how many acres do you use integrated nutrient management practices?)

fields.name: integrated_nutrient_management_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last use integrated nutrient management practices?)

fields.name: nutrient_management_other
fields.prompt: _(I perform other nutrient management actions)
fields.label: _(Other nutrient management practices)

fields.name: nutrient_management_other_action
fields.prompt: _(Please describe your actions below)

fields.name: pest_management_header
fields.content: C. Pest Management

fields.name: pest_management
fields.prompt: _(I use integrated pest management practices)
fields.label: _(Integrated pest management)

body: Integrated pest management consists of a comprehensive plan on how specific pest management risks will be prevented or mitigated.

fields.name: pest_management_quantity
fields.prompt: _(On how many acres do you use integrated pest management practices?)

fields.name: pest_management_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last use integrated pest management practices?)

fields.name: pest_management_other
fields.prompt: _(I perform other pest management actions)
fields.label: _(Other pest management practices)

fields.name: pest_management_other_action
fields.prompt: _(Please describe your actions below)

fields.name: range_management
fields.content: D. Range, Soil, & Wildlife Management

fields.name: weed_control
fields.prompt: _(I control herbaceous weeds)
fields.label: _(Herbaceous weed control)

body: Herbaceous weed control consists of removal of herbaceous weeds of light infestation by mowing.

fields.name: weed_control_quantity
fields.prompt: _(On how many acres do you control herbaceous weeds?)

fields.name: weed_control_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last remove herbaceous weeds?)

fields.name: prescribed_grazing
fields.prompt: _(I follow a prescribed grazing schedule)
fields.label: _(Prescribed grazing schedule)

body: A prescribed grazing schedule consists of an adaptively managed schedule for grazing on native species.

fields.name: prescribed_grazing_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many acres of your property follow a prescribed grazing schedule?)

fields.name: prescribed_grazing_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last follow a prescribed grazing schedule?)

fields.name: waste_storage
fields.prompt: _(I operate waste storage facilities)
fields.label: _(Waste storage facilities)

body: Waste storage facilities are earthen liquid waste impoundments constructed to store waste such as manure.

fields.name: waste_storage_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many waste storage facilities are on your property?)

fields.name: waste_storage_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last install a waste storage facility?)

fields.name: fencing
fields.prompt: _(I maintain fencing on my property)
fields.label: _(Fencing)

body: Fencing allows for the implementation of grazing management.

fields.name: fencing_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many linear feet of fencing do you maintain?)

fields.name: fencing_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last install fencing?)

fields.name: stock_watering
fields.prompt: _(I operate stock watering wells)
fields.label: _(Stock watering wells)

fields.name: stock_watering_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many stock watering wells do you operate?)

fields.name: stock_watering_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last install a stock watering well?)

fields.name: livestock_pipeline
fields.prompt: _(I maintain livestock watering pipelines)
fields.label: _(Livestock pipelines)

body: Livestock watering pipelines sit below ground and are for delivering water to a stock tank.

fields.name: livestock_pipeline_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many linear feet of livestock watering pipeline do you maintain?)

fields.name: livestock_pipeline_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last install livestock watering pipelines?)

fields.name: watering_facility
fields.prompt: _(I operate watering facilities)
fields.label: _(Watering facilities)

body: Watering facilities are a permanent livestock and/or wildlife watering facility for storage and/or drinking access.

fields.name: watering_facility_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many watering facilities do you operate?)

fields.name: watering_facility_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last install a watering facility?)

fields.name: spring_development
fields.prompt: _(I have watering springs on my property)
fields.label: _(Spring development)

body: A spring is a source to provide water for livestock and/or wildlife needs.

fields.name: spring_development_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many watering springs are on your property?)

fields.name: spring_development_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last develop a new watering spring?)

fields.name: pumping_plant
fields.prompt: _(I operate pumping plants)
fields.label: _(Spring development)

body: A pumping plant supplies a reliable water source for livestock.

fields.name: pumping_plant_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many pumping plants do you operate?)

fields.name: pumping_plant_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last install a pumping plant?)

fields.name: range_management_other
fields.prompt: _(I perform other range, soil, & wildlife management actions)
fields.label: _(Other range/soil/wildlife management practices)

fields.name: range_management_other_action
fields.prompt: _(Please describe your actions below)

fields.name: fish_wildlife_management
fields.content: E. Fish & Wildlife Management

fields.name: riparian_buffer
fields.prompt: _(I have riparian buffers on my property)
fields.label: _(Riparian buffers)

body: Riparian buffers are trees and/or shrubs to restore riparian plant communities and associated benefits.

fields.name: riparian_buffer_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many linear feet of riparian buffer do you have?)

fields.name: riparian_buffer_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last plant riparian buffers?)

fields.name: channel_bank_vegetation
fields.prompt: _(I have channel bank vegetation on my property)
fields.label: _(Channel bank vegetation)

body: Channel bank vegetation consists of willows for root cohesion.

fields.name: channel_bank_vegetation_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many acres of channel bank vegetation are on your property?)

fields.name: channel_bank_vegetation_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last plant channel bank vegetation?)

fields.name: streambank_fencing
fields.prompt: _(I maintain streambank and shoreline protection fencing)
fields.label: _(Streambank and shoreline fencing)

body: Streambank and shoreline protection fencing consists of bioengineered techniques.

fields.name: streambank_fencing_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many linear feet of streambank and shoreline protection fencing do you maintain?)

fields.name: streambank_fencing_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last install streambank and shoreline protection fencing?)

fields.name: stream_habitat
fields.prompt: _(I practice stream habitat improvement and management techniques)
fields.label: _(Stream habitat management)

body: Stream habitat improvement and management consists of log structures placed in stream channels to improve aquatic habitat.

fields.name: stream_habitat_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many acres of stream habitat do you improve and manage?)

fields.name: stream_habitat_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last perform stream habitat improvement and management techniques?)

fields.name: heavy_use_protection
fields.prompt: _(I protect heavy use areas)
fields.label: _(Heavy use area protection)

body: Heavy use area protection consists of maintaining stable, non-eroding surfaces with rock and/or gravel to stop soil erosion.

fields.name: heavy_use_protection_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many acres of heavy use area do you protect?)

fields.name: heavy_use_protection_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last perform heavy use area protection?)

fields.name: tree_shrub
fields.prompt: _(I establish trees and shrubs)
fields.label: _(Tree/shrub establishment)

body: Tree/shrub establishment consists of planting seedlings on prepared areas or woody cuttings or whips on natural floodplain areas.

fields.name: tree_shrub_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many acres of trees and shrubs have you established?)

fields.name: tree_shrub_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last establish new trees and shurbs?)

fields.name: rare_declining
fields.prompt: _(I have restored rare or declining habitats on my property)
fields.label: _(Rare/declining habitat restoration)

body: Rare and declining habitats are native plant or wildlife habitats that are a resource concern.

fields.name: rare_declining_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many acres of rare or declining habitats have you restored?)

fields.name: rare_declining_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last restore rare or declining habitats?)

fields.name: upland_habitat
fields.prompt: _(I manage upland wildlife habitats)
fields.label: _(Upland habitat management)

body: Upland wildlife habitat management consists of planting cover for food and nesting habitat.

fields.name: upland_habitat_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many acres of upland habitat do you manage?)

fields.name: upland_habitat_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last manage upland wildlife habitats?)

fields.name: wetland_restoration
fields.prompt: _(I have restored wetlands on my property)
fields.label: _(Wetlands restored)

body: Wetland restoration consists of protecting and or restoring water inundated areas.

fields.name: wetland_restoration_quantity
fields.prompt: _(How many acres of wetlands have you restored?)

fields.name: wetland_restoration_datetime
fields.prompt: _(Approximately when did you last restore wetlands?)

fields.name: fish_wildlife_management_other
fields.prompt: _(I perform other fish & wildlife management actions)
fields.label: _(Other fish & wildlife management practices)

fields.name: fish_wildlife_management_other_action
fields.prompt: _(Please describe your actions below)

fields.name: additional_info_header
fields.content: 8. Almost done!

fields.name: additional_info
fields.content:
Thank you for taking the time to report your stewardship practices.

Information on this page is optional, but will help Whitman County understand how landowners are implementing stewardship practices.

fields.name: my_image
fields.prompt: _(Show off your stewardship! Upload a few photos:)
fields.label: _(Upload photos)

fields.name: private-landowner_name
fields.prompt: _(What is your name?)

fields.name: private-use_photos
fields.prompt: _(Can Whitman County VSP highlight your photos on our website?)

fields.name: private-share_story
fields.prompt: _(Would you be willing to share your stewardship story with the public?)

fields.name: private-landowner_email
fields.prompt: _(What is your email address?)

fields.name: private-landowner_phone
fields.prompt: _(What is your phone number?)

content: Your local Conservation District is here to help you meet your stewardship goals.
Contact your Conservation District for more information:
We greatly appreciate your time in sharing land management practices to tell the story of current stewardship on the Palouse. All responses will remain confidential.
Click Get Started below to report your conservation practices!
